title: mise

oneOf.description: path to python virtual environment to use

create.description: create a new virtual environment if one does not exist

path.description: path to python virtual environment to use

python_create_args.description: additional arguments to pass to python when creating a virtual environment

uv_create_args.description: additional arguments to pass to uv when creating a virtual environment

activate_aggressive.description: Pushes tools' bin-paths to the front of PATH instead of allowing modifications of PATH after activation to take precedence.

all_compile.description: do not use precompiled binaries for any tool

always_keep_download.description: should mise keep downloaded files after installation

always_keep_install.description: should mise keep install files after installation even if the installation fails

baked_registry.description: Use baked-in aqua registry (if compiled in).

cosign.description: Use cosign to verify aqua tool signatures.

cosign_extra_args.description: Extra arguments to pass to cosign when verifying aqua tool signatures.

minisign.description: Use minisign to verify aqua tool signatures.

registry_url.description: URL to fetch aqua registry from.

slsa.description: Use SLSA to verify aqua tool signatures.

arch.description: Architecture to use for precompiled binaries.

asdf.description: use asdf as a default plugin backend

asdf_compat.description: set to true to ensure .tool-versions will be compatible with asdf

auto_install.description: Automatically install missing tools when running `mise x`, `mise run`, or as part of the 'not found' handler.

auto_install_disable_tools.description: List of tools to skip automatically installing when running `mise x`, `mise run`, or as part of the 'not found' handler.

cache_prune_age.description: Delete files in cache that have not been accessed in this duration

binstall.description: Use cargo-binstall instead of cargo install if available

registry_name.description: Name of the cargo registry to use.

cargo_binstall.description: Use cargo-binstall instead of cargo install if available

cd.description: Path to change to after launching mise

ci.description: Set to true if running in a CI environment

color.description: Use color in mise terminal output

default_config_filename.description: The default config filename read. `mise use` and other commands that create new config files will use this value. This must be an env var.

default_tool_versions_filename.description: The default .tool-versions filename read. This will not ignore .tool-versions—use override_tool_versions_filename for that. This must be an env var.

disable_backends.description: Backends to disable such as `asdf` or `pipx`

disable_default_registry.description: Disable the default mapping of short tool names like `go` -> `vfox:version-fox/vfox-golang`. This parameter disables only for the backends `vfox` and `asdf`.

disable_default_shorthands.description: Disables built-in shorthands to asdf/vfox plugins

disable_hints.description: Turns off helpful hints when using different mise features

disable_tools.description: Tools defined in mise.toml that should be ignored

package_flags.description: Extends dotnet search and install abilities.

registry_url.description: URL to fetch dotnet tools from.

enable_tools.description: Tools defined in mise.toml that should be used - all other tools are ignored

env.description: Env to use for mise.<MISE_ENV>.toml files.

env_file.description: Path to a file containing environment variables to automatically load.

compile.description: If true, compile erlang from source. If false, use precompiled binaries. If not set, use precompiled binaries if available.

exec_auto_install.description: Automatically install missing tools when running `mise x`.

experimental.description: Enable experimental mise features which are incomplete or unstable—breakings changes may occur

fetch_remote_versions_cache.description: How long to cache remote versions for tools.

fetch_remote_versions_timeout.description: Timeout in seconds for HTTP requests to fetch new tool versions in mise.

gix.description: Use gix for git operations, set to false to shell out to git.

global_config_file.description: Path to the global mise config file. Default is `~/.config/mise/config.toml`. This must be an env var.

global_config_root.description: Path which is used as `{{config_root}}` for the global config file. Default is `$HOME`. This must be an env var.

go_default_packages_file.description: Path to a file containing default go packages to install when installing go

go_download_mirror.description: Mirror to download go sdk tarballs from.

go_set_gobin.description: Changes where `go install` installs binaries to.

go_skip_checksum.description: Set to true to skip checksum verification when downloading go sdk tarballs.

gpg_verify.description: Use gpg to verify all tool signatures.

http_timeout.description: Timeout in seconds for all HTTP requests in mise.

idiomatic_version_file.description: Set to false to disable the idiomatic version files such as .node-version, .ruby-version, etc.

idiomatic_version_file_disable_tools.description: Specific tools to disable idiomatic version files for.

idiomatic_version_file_enable_tools.description: Specific tools to enable idiomatic version files for like .node-version, .ruby-version, etc.

ignored_config_paths.description: This is a list of config paths that mise will ignore.

jobs.description: How many jobs to run concurrently such as tool installs.

legacy_version_file.description: Set to false to disable the idiomatic version files such as .node-version, .ruby-version, etc.

legacy_version_file_disable_tools.description: Specific tools to disable idiomatic version files for.

libgit2.description: Use libgit2 for git operations, set to false to shell out to git.

lockfile.description: Create and read lockfiles for tool versions.

flavor.description: Install a specific node flavor like glibc-217 or musl. Use with unofficial node build repo.

gpg_verify.description: Use gpg to verify node tool signatures.

mirror_url.description: Mirror to download node tarballs from.

not_found_auto_install.description: Set to false to disable the "command not found" handler to autoinstall missing tool versions.

bun.description: Use bun instead of npm if bun is installed and on PATH.

os.description: OS to use for precompiled binaries.

override_config_filenames.description: If set, mise will ignore default config files like `mise.toml` and use these filenames instead. This must be an env var.

override_tool_versions_filenames.description: If set, mise will ignore .tool-versions files and use these filenames instead. Can be set to `none` to disable .tool-versions. This must be an env var.

pin.description: Default to pinning versions when running `mise use` in mise.toml files.

registry_url.description: URL to use for pipx registry.

uvx.description: Use uvx instead of pipx if uv is installed and on PATH.

pipx_uvx.description: Use uvx instead of pipx if uv is installed and on PATH.

plugin_autoupdate_last_check_duration.description: How long to wait before updating plugins automatically (note this isn't currently implemented).

profile.description: Profile to use for mise.${MISE_PROFILE}.toml files.

compile.description: If true, compile python from source. If false, use precompiled binaries. If not set, use precompiled binaries if available.

default_packages_file.description: Path to a file containing default python packages to install when installing a python version.

patch_url.description: URL to fetch python patches from to pass to python-build.

patches_directory.description: Directory to fetch python patches from.

precompiled_arch.description: Specify the architecture to use for precompiled binaries.

precompiled_flavor.description: Specify the flavor to use for precompiled binaries.

precompiled_os.description: Specify the OS to use for precompiled binaries.

pyenv_repo.description: URL to fetch pyenv from for compiling python with python-build.

uv_venv_auto.description: Integrate with uv to automatically create/source venvs if uv.lock is present.

uv_venv_create_args.description: Arguments to pass to uv when creating a venv.

venv_stdlib.description: Prefer to use venv from Python's standard library.

python_compile.description: If true, compile python from source. If false, use precompiled binaries. If not set, use precompiled binaries if available.

python_venv_auto_create.description: Automatically create virtualenvs for python tools.

python_venv_stdlib.description: Prefer to use venv from Python's standard library.

apply_patches.description: A list of patch files or URLs to apply to ruby source.

default_packages_file.description: Path to a file containing default ruby gems to install when installing ruby.

verbose_install.description: Set to true to enable verbose output during ruby installation.

cargo_home.description: Path to the cargo home directory. Defaults to `~/.cargo` or `%USERPROFILE%\.cargo`

rustup_home.description: Path to the rustup home directory. Defaults to `~/.rustup` or `%USERPROFILE%\.rustup`

shorthands_file.description: Path to a file containing custom tool shorthands.

silent.description: Suppress all `mise run|watch` output except errors—including what tasks output.

age_key.description: The age private key to use for sops secret decryption.

age_key_file.description: Path to the age private key file to use for sops secret decryption.

age_recipients.description: The age public keys to use for sops secret encryption.

rops.description: Use rops to decrypt sops files. Disable to shell out to `sops` which will slow down mise but sops may offer features not available in rops.

missing_tools.description: Show a warning if tools are not installed when entering a directory with a mise.toml file.

show_env.description: Show configured env vars when entering a directory with a mise.toml file.

show_tools.description: Show configured tools when entering a directory with a mise.toml file.

gpg_verify.description: Use gpg to verify swift tool signatures.

platform.description: Override the platform to use for precompiled binaries.

system_config_file.description: Path to the system mise config file. Default is `/etc/mise/config.toml`. This must be an env var.

task_disable_paths.description: Paths that mise will not look for tasks in.

task_output.description: Change output style when executing tasks.

task_remote_no_cache.description: Mise will always fetch the latest tasks from the remote, by default the cache is used.

task_run_auto_install.description: Automatically install missing tools when executing tasks.

task_skip.description: Tasks to skip when running `mise run`.

task_timings.description: Show completion message with elapsed time for each task on `mise run`. Default shows when output type is `prefix`.

trusted_config_paths.description: This is a list of config paths that mise will automatically mark as trusted.

unix_default_file_shell_args.description: List of default shell arguments for unix to be used with `file`. For example `sh`.

unix_default_inline_shell_args.description: List of default shell arguments for unix to be used with inline commands. For example, `sh`, `-c` for sh.

use_file_shell_for_executable_tasks.description: Determines whether to use a specified shell for executing tasks in the tasks directory. When set to true, the shell defined in the file will be used, or the default shell specified by `windows_default_file_shell_args` or `unix_default_file_shell_args` will be applied. If set to false, tasks will be executed directly as programs.

use_versions_host.description: Set to false to disable using the mise-versions API as a quick way for mise to query for new versions.

verbose.description: Shows more verbose output such as installation logs when installing tools.

vfox.description: Use vfox as a default plugin backend instead of asdf.

windows_default_file_shell_args.description: List of default shell arguments for Windows to be used for file commands. For example, `cmd`, `/c` for cmd.exe.

windows_default_inline_shell_args.description: List of default shell arguments for Windows to be used for inline commands. For example, `cmd`, `/c` for cmd.exe.

windows_executable_extensions.description: List of executable extensions for Windows. For example, `exe` for .exe files, `bat` for .bat files, and so on.

windows_shim_mode.description: Shim file mode for Windows. Options: `file`, `hardlink`, `symlink`.
